meta.name: FiveOnFive_Lockdown
meta.description: Standard 5v5 lockdown profile for protecting a lead in the 3rd period. Biases toward defensive stability, controlled exits, and low-risk offense.
meta.author: Austin Olsen

notes: Match against opposing top line when possible.
Avoid high-risk east-west plays at both blue lines.
Primary matchup vs opponent best scoring line when available.
F1 pressure on puck carrier, F2/F3 collapse to slot.
Short shifts, finish checks without taking penalties.
Chip pucks deep, cycle low, no cross-ice slot passes.
Used after icings / long shifts by opponent.
Glass-and-out is acceptable; avoid middle turnovers.
Hard match vs opponent top line when possible.
Keep tight gap in NZ, protect inside lane first.
Join rush selectively only with clear numbers advantage.
First read is always net-front coverage in DZ.
Rely on simple outs: rims, glass-and-out, safe chips.
Avoid carrying into traffic at own blue line.

guidelines: Use center-low support to shorten exits when under pressure.
Avoid up-the-middle passes unless lane is completely clean.
On 50/50 pucks, priority is to avoid odd-man rushes against.

allowed_when: clear possession with full forward support
weak-side D stays home and F3 high

notes: Steer rushes wide, deny middle lane entries.
F1 angles puck carrier, D hold blue line with good gaps.
Low-to-high, point shots with traffic are preferred.
Do not force cross-crease passes through sticks.

use_timeout_when: lead is 1 goal and team is pinned for > 60 seconds of continuous pressure
after icing with a tired shutdown pair on the ice in final 3 minutes

faceoff_matchups.dz_defensive_zone: Use best defensive center + shutdown pair
faceoff_matchups.nz_neutral_zone: Use line2 or line1 with best FO rating

notes_for_dynasty_ai: When user issues /mode lockdown or equivalent intent, bias all tactical advice toward this profile.
Line changes should be small and role-respecting; do not blow up chemistry unless emergency.
For reports, tag any period where this profile is active with 'lockdown_mode_active: true' in runtime snapshots.
